transliteration: Daroo Baan Barkhan|| Bdaroo Deb(i) Harkhan||30||152||
translation: The goddess Durga, being very much pleased, hath begun showering the rain of arrows.30.152.

transliteration: Ite Deb(i) Mdarai|| Outai Singh(u) Phdarai||
translation: On this side, the goddess is busy in killing and on the other side the lion is tearing up all.

transliteration: Gadan Good Gadjain|| Sabhai Dait Larjain||31||153||
translation: Hearing the roars of the Ganas (attendants) of Shiva, the demons have become frightened.31.153.

transliteration: Bhaoo Baan Barkhaa|| Gad Jeet(i) Karkhaa||
translation: There was rain of arrows and with this the goddess became victorious.

transliteration: Sabhai Doust Mdare|| Maiyaa Sant Oubhare||32||154||
translation: All the tyrants were killed by the goddess and the Mother saved the saints.32.154.
The goddess killed Nisumbh and destroyed the army of demons.

transliteration: Soubhai Doust Bhaaje|| Itai Singh Gadje||33||155||
translation: On this side the lion roared and form the other side all the demons fled.33.155.

transliteration: Bhaoo Puhap Barkhaa|| Gad Jeet Karkhaa||
translation: On the victory of the army of gods, there was rain of flowers.

transliteration: Jayan Sant Janpai|| Trasai Dait Kanpai||34||156||
translation: The saints hailed it nd the demos trembled with fear.34.156.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky cMfI cirqRy insuMB bDh pMcmo iDAwie sMpUrx msqu suB msqu ]5]APjU ]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Bachitra Naatake Channdoo Charitre Nisounbh Badhah Panchamo Dhiaae Sanpooran Mast(u) Soubh Mast(u)||5||afjoo||
translation: Here ends the Fifth Chapter entitled ‘The Killing of Nisumbh’ of Chandi Charitra in BACHITTAR NATAK.5.
Now the war with Sumbh is described:

gurmukhi: lGu BRwq ju`JXo sunXo suMB rwXM ]
transliteration: Lagh(u) Bhraat Jujjhyo Sounyo Sounbh Raayan||
translation: When Sumbh heard about the death of his younger brother;
